alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Douglas; Heard; South Fulton; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:17AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Carroll, southwestern Douglas, Heard, northern Troup, western Coweta and southwestern Fulton Counties through 800 AM EDT... At 716 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Treasure Lake to near Plant Wansley to near Roanoke, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Carrollton, Franklin, City of South Fulton, Palmetto, Hogansville, Grantville, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Moreland, Roopville, Chattahoochee Hills, East Newnan, Corinth, Plant Yates, Seaton Lake, and Fairplay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Coweta; Douglas; Heard; South Fulton; Troup
